title: Competence Centre Programme Stuttgart Region

author: Stephanie Fleischmann, Wirtschaftsförderung Region Stuttgart GmbH

segmentation: Thank you Mr Chairman, ladies and gentlemen.
Thank you to the cat Network for awarding the Super region yesterday evening.
Um, I will tell you this morning about the stupid region about the success of the suit, good region and about of about one of the programs that is run in the Stuttgart region.
The so called competence center program.
It's a program for bringing together research and development from the private and the public side, bringing together companies, research institutions and networks.
Universities, so it's.
Apple and a presentation about Switzerland.
First about the region itself, then and then.
About this program.
So the location of the Subcode region.
Most of you probably know.
We are not a region in the European sense.
the European region would be bad and looking back to state of Brandenburg, the Stuttgart region is just a part of Brandenburg.
A quite big part if you think economy wise a small part.
If you think area wise.
And the circuit region consists of the capital city of Stuttgart and the six surrounding counties.
I brought you a few.
Facts and figures and with this.
Facts and figures.
I would like also to explain a little bit why the secret region is so successful and why we were awarded this award.
As far as yesterday already said.
2.7 million people are living in this ticket region, many of them coming from other countries from European countries from countries all over the world.
From 100 and 7070 countries actually.
The region consists of 179 municipalities.
Out of the two point 7 million people living in the Super Region, 1.3 million are in employment.
The cross domestic product is 1 around 100 million euro.
It's about 1/3.
Yeah, roughly 1/3 of the gross domestic product of patent Gothenburg.
We are very lucky that we do to our economic success.
We have a quite low unemployment rate.
It's less than 5% even during the crisis.
In the last two to three years it was.
A little bit higher, but still quite low.
Our most most important industries are automotive production, technology, mechanical engineering and the creative industries.
And if you look at the left side, I placed some company logos there and.
If you look at the.
Apple three logos.
Basically Daimler, Porsche and Bosch.
They are one of the SuccessFactors of the region.
Why?
Because.
There are intelligent people at the beginning, Gottlieb time long, the founder of Daimler.
Together he came later together, or his company came together with the company of Karl Benz.
The founder, together with the founders of the automobile.
Portia, Ferdinand Portia, who founded the company, was an engineer at Daimler Benz, and then he founded his own company in the Stuttgart region.
And Bush was founded by robot Bush.
Or Bush also lived in the Stuttgart region.
He founded his business there.
He did his inventions there.
So these three people, among others are.
One of the main reasons why this occurred region is so successful, successful today.
They invented their companies there.
They were highly innovative.
There were risk takers and if you look at the companies today, you see what happened during the time.
The companies overtime.
Had their headquarters all the time in Stuttgart.
They remained there.
They have lots of factories and plants in the Stuttgart region.
They invest.
Very high amounts in research and development and I work together with research institutions with universities, so it's really a good.
Innovation and research.
Climate industry trade region.
There are some other logos, for example trumph.
Vert market leader basically in laser technologies also owned by a family.
You can steal the company as well festal, so stupid region is also a case for many.

Family owned businesses not only small businesses but medium sized and larger businesses that are owned by families and I was sitting yesterday on the table discussing about corporate social responsibilities for these family owned businesses.
Corporate social responsibility is not something knew that something they live for a long time now.
And the two pictures on the upper left corner should show you that the Stuttgart region is not just an industrialized industrialized region, not just about.
Mechanical engineering and automotive.
It's also about living.
It's a quite nice area and we have lots of culture museums and also a very nice surrounding.
And if you think about.
Qualified people you want to attract to a region or to an area?
Is important as well.
We received an award for the R&D for research and development in the region, and besides the very successful companies, there is a R&D infrastructure.
They work together very closely so the R&D expenditure just by the business sector is 6.5% of the GDP.
Unfortunately, I cannot tell you RND rate.
This, including the public expenditure because the Statistical Office doesn't calculate this.
There are two less players in the game, so they just give us the 6.5%.
Expenditure by the business sector.
This is mainly due to the large companies I mentioned before, but also many smaller medium sized enterprises are really working intensively on research and development.
Looking at the infrastructure more from the public side, there are numerous University research facilities.
Two Max Planck Institutes with which are more working on the basic research, 5 Fraunhofer institutes.
They're more working on applied research working together.
A lot of companies.
And you can see it your.
A lot of additional research into institutions.
Some of them are more basic research, more.
Some of them are more applied research.
So this is just very good research and development climate in with.
In the region.
Just slide will just give you a short introduction to the company.
I come from the Stuttgart region, Economic Development Corporation or in German, which offered a lick you in Stuttgart.
We are a private company, but our main shareholder is for Bentley you in Stuttgart, which is the public authority of the Stuttgart region.
We have several different tasks.
Support for investors.
Marketing for the region and innovation and cluster policy, and I would focus on one.
Program the Competence center program.
Because this is the program that brings together companies and the R&D.
Infra
Struction.
So what's the mission?
About this competent center program.
A competent center is a well organized regional network, integrating possibly all regional companies, universities, research facilities in the same field of technology.
So is it is not a branch oriented approach.
This would be too broad.
It's a technology oriented approach.
They should.
Provide a base for know how exchange for innovative cooperation and for projects.
Bringing together the players in these different fields.
So here again.
What are the objectives?
We tried to.
Support with these networks.
They should be catalysts for cooperation, cooperation and competitiveness.
Initiate and support cooperation between businesses, universities, research facilities and other relevant organization because it still even in this innovative climate in the Stuttgart region.
It's still.
A challenge I would say to bring together companies especially small and medium size companies and research facilities and universities.
With this Institute we try institutions we try to bridge this gap.
These competent centers are organized not just as virtual networks.
They are organized usually as a registered SoC or Association, and they usually employ at least one professional manager to organized cooperation processes and to provide.
Support services for the companies.
Some of them have laps or facilities that members can use.
But it's important to have this person bringing together.
Their members because the competent centers are organized as on a membership basis, the members pay fees.
So it's.
Similar as you told us, in Switzerland, not the public body is giving money to these networks and they are working with universities and companies.
The networks are membership based and based on the financial side on the membership fees.
So only companies and institutions that see a benefit out of it and see the possibilities.
Within this network, take part in these networks and finance the network.
Above that they apply for European and federal grants, and some of them get at least in the.
First 2 three years support from the municipalities where they are located.
Just a short track record about this.
How we established how the region established these networks.
A little bit more than 10 years ago there was a competition for initiating these networks.
Municipalities with companies had to apply for establishing a competent centers and in the first phase there was money.
Regional money for the Establishment, 2 million for all the competent centers that were it established altogether.
It's not a big part of money, it's at least.
It was money for the beginning of for the start of this networks and then since 2003.
The competent centers can only apply for project based money for regional money for projects, and it's similar to what you heard about Switzerland.
It's not.
There are no calls for proposals.
The competent centers approach the region with innovative ideas with ideas for project and they get this project financed.
So this is the map of the competence center as it looks right now.

They are distributed all over the region, they're open, they're regional competence centers, but they're open networks for companies research, research institutions from other regions from Europe as well.
There are competent Centers for example, for virtual reality, for mechatronics packaging technology.
Logistics so in different fields of technology working together.
And with this program.
A significant contribution could be made to.
Bringing together companies and research institutions.
Also with them.
A little public money.
Extensive private investments could be triggered.
More than 100 projects were financed since the start of the program.
And we could help the networks to apply also for European and Federal.

Programs federal money as well, and there is a constant request for additional competent centers and you competent center was founded just a week ago and lots of other regions in Europe are very interested in the program.
So as small best practice case, what are lessons learned regarding the competent centers?
The most important instrument would be a network manager.
The most important process is communication between the partners.
Not always easy, but that's really important to bring the members together.
We think that the most important legal component is that there is a legal body for the network that it's not not just a virtual network.
And the most important task is to initiate concrete projects where the members could work together.
So thank you very much.
There's the contact data.
There's also a website and I'm available for questions.
